            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */

                $.getJSON("http://magicvalley.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){

                });

            }

            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>JEROME • The city of Jerome has avoided the need for a boil order for drinking water, after a water main broke this afternoon.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>A Times-News reporter at the scene says the water main at South Cedar Street and West Avenue G has been repaired in enough time to avoid the need for the boil order.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The water line is now being charged and water service should be available in about an hour and a half, according to a notice from the city.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>It's not immediately clear how the main broke. The break occurred earlier this afternoon.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://magicvalley.com/tncms/block/1415851/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {

                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ 
            var iAttempt = 0;

                  //__tnt.log('No DMP audiences passed.');
                  
                    sMode = 'block-contextual-fallback';

                    //__tnt.log('No audiences or keywords to work with. Remove block');

                    return;
                  }
               }

               for(var nIdx = 0; nIdx < aAudiences.length; nIdx++) {
                  aAudiences[nIdx] = aAudiences[nIdx].replace('keyword:', '');

                         //__tnt.log('No assets in response.');
                         if (iAttempt < iMaxAttempt) {
                             //__tnt.log('Going in for more assets...');
                             getRecommendations_1415907();
                         } else {

                            $("#tncms-block-1415907").remove();

                     }
                     
                     var aAssets = shuffle_1415907(oResponse.assets);

                     for(var nIdx = 0; (nIdx < oResponse.assets.length && iCount < iMax); nIdx++) { 
                         if ( oResponse.assets[nIdx].content.includes('inline-summary') && !(oResponse.assets[nIdx].content.includes('be6674d6-fb88-11e1-befd-001a4bcf887a'))  ) {

                    temporaryValue = array[currentIndex];
                    array[currentIndex] = array[randomIndex];
                    array[randomIndex] = temporaryValue;
                }

        Miller: 50 years</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>PLATTSBURGH – Gerald (Richard) and Linda (Flint) Miller of Plattsburgh, N.Y. celebrated their 50<sup>th</sup> wedding anniversary on September 29<sup>th</sup>, 2017. Linda and Richard were married at St. Peter’s church, Plattsburgh, N.Y. on September 29<sup>th</sup>, 1967.</p>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">BLACK BROOK — A boil-water order is in place for those whose water comes from Black Brook Water District No. 1, from Fairview Cemetery up Golf Course Road, including Ausable Valley Golf Club, according the a release from the Clinton County Health Department.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Town Supervisor Ricky Nolan said the order was necessitated by a water-line break.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Water must be boiled before ingesting, according to Health Department instructions. Bring all water to a rolling boil in a clean container, let it boil for one minute and let it cool before using. Those affected may use bottled water certified by the New York State Department of Health or water from a state-approved public water system for drinking, making ice, washing dishes, brushing teeth and food preparation.</p>
<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">For more information, reach the Health Department at 565-4870.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block visible-xs" id="tncms-block-1108091">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Precautionary boil order lifted in Durant

By KXII-TV Staff&nbsp|&nbsp
Posted: Mon 12:23 PM, Sep 10, 2012

DURANT, OK - After a water main break and a precuationary boil order was issued over the weekend, Durant city officials say the town's water supply is safe to use.

After a major water main break late Friday evening in Durant, the City of Durant had issued a Precautionary Boil Order for drinking water purposes. Following the repair of the broken water main, the City of Durant says they did a water quality test to insure that there were no contaminants in the water supply.

The city says the results of the test indicate that the water is good, and there is no need to continue the boil order.

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/florida/sarasota/politics">politics & government</a> <h1>
      County Repairing Water Main Break In Coronado    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">Sarasota County Utilities have issued a precautionary boil water advisory for the Coronado subdivision in Sarasota.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/charles-schelle-9c9f10ae">Charles Schelle, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-09-09 19:16:25">Sep 9, 2012 7:16 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/10271572/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/florida/sarasota/county-repairing-water-main-break-in-coronado" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->
</div>
</header> <!-- /#page-header -->
<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>

Water Main Break In Coronado”"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-comments"></span><span class="disqus-comment-count p bold visible-lg-block visible-md-block visible-sm-block visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="10271572">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="County Repairing Water Main Break In Coronado" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/975664/2012/09/T800x600/c022e8df54b3c69fbc7930ad9cb2ae4c.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>Sarasota County Utiliites crews are repairing a water main break in the Coronado subdivision today, prompting a precautionary boil water advisory.</p> <p>The early Sunday morning break effects about 176 residents living on Coronado Drive, Thornwood Road, Cross Creek Road and Cross Creek Drive in Sarasota, according to the county. Water service has been restored, and residents have been notified by automated phone message.</p> <p>Sarasota County is issuing a precautionary boil water advisory urging affected customers to boil all water intended for drinking, preparation of food, washing of food utensils, making ice, brushing teeth or for first aid, making sure the water is brought to a rolling boil for one minute. Boiling the tap water disinfects it, destroying harmful microorganisms. Bottled water can be used as an alternative to boiling the tap water. </p> <p>The county will collect a series of samples and analyze them to ensure the drinking water wasn't contaminated by potentially harmful bacteria during the service interruption. Water customers will be notified by automated telephone calls that the boil water advisory has been canceled.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Boil water order lifted for Pittsburg residents

PITTSBURG, IL (KFVS) -

The boil water order issued for the Village of Pittsburg, Illinois Water Supply customers has been lifted.

Officials say it was for customers on Longstreet west of Route 37 in Marion.

Boil water order Monday for Alto Pass water customers

ALTO PASS, IL (KFVS) -

A boil water order will be in effect for customers of Alto Pass Water District beginning Monday at 7 a.m.

According to the water district, the order could be in effect for several days. This is due to construction improvements on the water system.

Boil water notice issued for Shirley Creek Estates

ETOILE, TX (KTRE) -

As a result of a service line break on Sept. 7, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) ordered the Etoile Water Supply to notify customers in Shirley Creek Estates of the need to boil their water.

To ensure destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes, water for drinking, cooking, and making ice should be boiled and cooled prior to use. The water should be brought to a vigorous, rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water or obtain water from other suitable source.

When it is no longer necessary to boil the water, the water system officials will notify you that the water is safe for consumption. Instructions to discontinue boiling will be issued in the same manner as this notice.

If you have questions in regard to this matter, you may contact Charlie Luse at (936) 854-2215.

Boil water notice cancelled The Lufkin News The Lufkin News

The boil water notice issued Thursday for Redland Water Supply customers who live on Ray Fisher Road and Hartnett Road has been cancelled. For more information contact Redland Water Supply at 634-5070, or Manager Michael Moore at 212-1956.

West Palm issues boil water notice

September 6, 2012|Staff report

The city of West Palm Beach issued a boil water notice for residents located from 15th Street to 23rd Street, between Division Avenue and the FEC railroad tracks.

The notice was issued after water main break occurred at the intersection of Grant Street and Tamarind Avenue.

Residents in the affected area are asked to boil their drinking water until further notice.'

Tammany Utilities rescinds boil-water order

Print Email
Jim Derry, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune By Jim Derry, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune The Times-Picayune
Follow on Twitter
on September 04, 2012 at 3:54 PM
comments

All boil orders for St. Tammany Parish have been rescinded after Tammany Utilities received confirmation from the Louisiana Department of Health and Hospitals that all collected water samples were negative for coliform bacteria. Most of the orders had been in place for several days in the aftermath of Hurricane Isaac.

Tammany Utilities says it is now safe to drink their water.

Neighborhoods which had been affected included:

o Lake Hills (Lake Hills Village, Lake Hills Village Shopping Center)

o Madisonville Woods (Madisonville Woods Subdivision)

o St. Gertrude (St. Gertrude Heights)

o St. Joe (St. Joe Estates, Salvation Manor)

o Bedico Creek (Bedico Creek, Cedar Creek)

o Pineland Park (Pineland Park)

o River Oaks (River Oaks Subdivision - Slidell)

o Lazy Creek (Lazy Creek Subdivision)

Boil Water Advisory for Burkesville Street, Lancaster Drive has been lifted

September 5, 2012 By ACCV Editor

Share on Facebook Share
Share on TwitterTweet
Send To Devices Send

September 5, 2012
As of 11:00 a.m. on September 5, 2012 the boil water advisory for customers on Burkesville Street and Lancaster Drive has been lifted by the Division of Water Columbia office. This means your water is safe for human consumption. You no longer have to boil your water.

Thank you
Columbia Adair Utilities District

BOIL WATER ADVISORY
Date Issued 09/04/12
Time Issued 10:00 a.m.
A BOIL WATER ADVISORY is in effect for consumers of Columbia Adair Utilities District for customers on Burkesville St and Lancaster Drive.

The advisory has been issued due to main line leak.

Following such an event, the potential exists for bacteriological contamination of the water supply therefore this Boil Water Advisory has been issued as a precautionary measure.

Until further notice, boil all water used for drinking and cooking, bringing the water to a rolling boil for three minutes before using.

This advisory will remain in effect until the situation has been corrected and test results have shown the water to be of an acceptable quality.

For more information concerning the Boil Water Advisory, contact Lennon Stone at Columbia Adair Utilities District, 270-384-2181.

Filed Under: Headline News

                        September 04, 2012 07:49 AM

<div class="dateline-storybody">
<div class="clearfix" id="story-target">
<div class="content-body" id="content-body-">
<p>MANATEE -- Manatee County officials have lifted three boil water advisories issued Friday after water main breaks.</p>
<p>The affected areas were: areas along U.S. 301 in Ellenton, including the Plantation Bay and Highland Shores subdivisions; areas along U.S. 41 from Florida Boulevard to 68th Avenue West; and 17th Street Court East, from Tallevast Road to 78th Drive East in Tallevast.</p>

            var eventMethod = window.addEventListener ? "addEventListener" : "attachEvent";
            var eventer = window[eventMethod];
            var messageEvent = eventMethod == "attachEvent" ? "onmessage" : "message";
            
            $("<iframe/>", {
                "class" : "col-xs-12",
                "src" : randomUrl,
                "scrolling" : "no",
                "frameborder" : "no"
            }).appendTo("#newsletter-signUpWidget");
            
            eventer(messageEvent, function(e) {
                if (randomUrl.indexOf(e.origin) != -1 ) {
                    var key = e.message ? "message" : "data";
                    var data = JSON.parse(e[key]);
                    
                    switch(data.messageid) {
                        case 100:
                            var signupevent = new CustomEvent( 'signup', {"detail": data} );
                            window.dispatchEvent( signupevent );
                            break;
                        case 200:
                            $('#newsletter-signUpWidget iframe').css('height', data.iframe.height);
                            break;
                    }

                }
            }, false );
        })();
    </script>

<!--Needs to be on the DOM on page load for IE. Needs to be visible to set the correct height of the comment component. I'm hiding it on document ready. Appending it later did not work-->
<div class="fb-comments in" data-href="" data-numposts="10" data-width="100%" id="fb-comments"></div>
<script>
(function(){
  var $commentingContainer = $('#commenting-container'),
      $commentContainerChevron = $commentingContainer.find(".glyphicon-chevron-down"),
      $fbComments = $("#fb-comments");
      
    if($("meta[property='fb:app_id']").length === 1 && $("meta[name='allow-comments']").prop("content") === "true") {
         
      $commentingContainer.on('click', 'a.comments-toggle', function(){
        if (typeof mi.commenting === "undefined") {
            mi.commenting = new mi.Commenting();
            mi.commenting.setConf( {
                accountName: mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.domain'),
                fbapp_id: mi.pageInfo.getConf('facebook.app.id'),
                fb_comment_div: {'data-width': '100%'}
            });
            mi.commenting.display();
            FB.XFBML.parse(document.getElementById("fb-comments"));
        }
        
        toggleComments();
      });
      
      $(document).ready(function(){
        toggleComments();
      });
      
    } else {
      
        var disabledText = 'Comments have been disabled for this story.';
        $fbComments.prepend("<p><strong>" + disabledText + "</strong></p>");
        
    }
    
    //toggleClass() wasn't working in IE the first time if it has the class
    function toggleComments(){
      if ($fbComments.hasClass('in')) {
          $fbComments.removeClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.removeClass("rotate");
      }else {
          $fbComments.addClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.addClass("rotate");
      }
    }
})();
</script>

<h4 class="media-title">Vandals try to break into high school</h4>
<p class="media-leadtext">On November 25, 2017, at approximately 3:30 am,
three unidentified suspects attempted to force their way into Steinbrenner High School located at 5575 Lutz Lake Fern Road, Lutz, in Hillsborough County. The suspects were determined to get inside the school and used anything they
could get their hands on to the break through the windows but were unsuccessful.  As a result of their multiple failed attempts to get inside the school, they did manage to cause at least $2,500 in damage to the glass window panes and door. Anyone with any information reference these suspects is asked to call the Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office at 247-8200 or anyone with any information regarding the identity and whereabouts of these suspects and who
wants to be eligible for a cash reward is asked to call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-873-TIPS (8477), report anonymously online at www.crimestopperstb.com or
send a mobile tip using our P3 Tips Mobile application, which is a free download for iPhones, iPads and Droids. You must call Crime Stoppers first to be eligible for a reward.
</p>
</li>
</ul>

Boil advisory issued in Walker

  • Links Mentioned on WAFBMore>>

  • Rumors vs Facts on FEMA disaster assistance for Isaac

    Rumors vs Facts on FEMA disaster assistance for Isaac

    RUMOR: There's no easy way to get true, reliable info about FEMA's disaster aid programs. FACT: Straight answers and plain facts are available from the disaster aid program experts on FEMA's HelpMore >>
    RUMOR: There's no easy way to get true, reliable info about FEMA's disaster aid programs. FACT: Straight answers and plain facts are available from the disaster aid program experts on FEMA's HelpMore >>

Information from the City of Walker:

WALKER, LA - A private utility company working to restore power after Hurricane Isaac struck an eight-inch water main in the City of Walker tonight, disrupting water service to customers.

The City of Walker's Department of Public Works crews are on the scene now working to restore service to the affected area.

A boil advisory has been issued for all residents living east of Walker Baptist Church and North of U.S. 190 who receive water service from the City of Walker, as well as residents south of U.S. 190 on Aime Street, Clarence Street and Valarie Street. The advisory will remain in effect for at least 24 hours.

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the following measures are recommended during a boil advisory:

  • Bring tap water to a rolling boil for at least three minutes and let it cool before consuming it or using it in any manner in which it will be consumed, such as rinsing raw foods, washing dishes or brushing teeth.
  • Do not serve or consume water that has not been disinfected. Drink commercially bottled water.
  • Do not use ice or drinks made with water that has not been disinfected.
  • Do not consume raw foods rinsed with water that has not been disinfected.
  • Discard ice made prior to the boil water advisory issuance and discontinue making ice. Use commercially manufactured ice.
  • Make sure water given to pets has been disinfected. Use bottled water if necessary.
  • For hand-washing, wet hands with water alternatives listed above or use an antibacterial cleanser that does not require water.
  • When the boil water advisory is cancelled, flush pipes and faucets. Run cold water faucets continuously for at least five minutes. Flush home automatic ice makers by making three batches of ice cubes and discarding all three batches. Change all point-of-entry and point-of-use water filters.

"We apologize for any inconvenience this causes to our residents," says Mayor Bobby Font. "This rupture was entirely beyond our control, but we are issuing this boil advisory as a precautionary measure to keep our residents safe."

The city will notify the public once the boil advisory ends.

Boil water advisory for Grand Isle is lifted as region recovers from Hurricane Isaac

Print Email
Martha Carr, Nola.com|The Times-Picayune By Martha Carr, Nola.com|The Times-Picayune The Times-Picayune
Follow on Twitter
on September 02, 2012 at 6:51 PM, updated September 02, 2012 at 6:54 PM
comments

Jefferson Parish has lifted the boil water advisory for the town of Grand Isle, now that pressure has been restored to the system and water samples collected on Saturday came back uncontaminated. Customers on Grand Isle may now use the water without boiling or disinfecting. Normal water service is expected to be maintained from now on.

For more information, contact the Jefferson Parish Water Quality Lab at 504-838-4300.

Post-Isaac boil water advisory canceled for Venetian Isles neighborhood

Print Email
Times-Picayune Staff By Times-Picayune Staff The Times-Picayune
Follow on Twitter
on September 01, 2012 at 9:08 PM, updated September 01, 2012 at 9:18 PM
comments

After consulting with the state Department of Health and Hospitals, the New Orleans Sewerage & Water Board has canceled a boil water advisory for residents and businesses in Venetian Isles, officials said Saturday night. The precautionary advisory was called because the city was concerned that the water at the end of the distribution system could have become stagnant from lack of use after Hurricane Isaac evacuations.

It was canceled after bacteriological tests confirmed that water in the area was safe to drink and could be used as normal for personal needs.

View full size

The Venetian Isles neighborhood falls at the end of the board's distribution system.

Customers should flush their internal and external plumbing by running water through their systems, officials said.

Boil water advisory issued for part of Laurens Co.

Posted: Updated:
Water drips from an Upstate man's faucet. (File/FOX Carolina)
LAURENS, SC (FOX Carolina) -

Officials in Laurens County have issued a boil water advisory after a water main broke Friday morning.

The Laurens County Water and Sewer Commission said the advisory affects customers located south of Highway 76 near Hickory Tavern. 

The advisory area includes Neely Ferry Road (from Wasson Gin to Ekom Beach), Wilsontown Road (including all of Lake Rabon Estates), Boyds Mill Pond Road, Hood Creek Road, Pitts Road and small roads off of these roads.

Customers are urged to vigorously boil water for at least one minute prior to drinking or cooking until otherwise notified.

Officials said work performed by a contractor along the shoulder of Highway 252 resulted in damage to a water main, affecting water service. They said the water system is not known to be contaminated, but there is a potential for contamination exists.

Questions should be directed to the commission.

Creve Coeur rescinds boil order

Friday
Sep 14, 2012 at 12:01 AM Sep 14, 2012 at 1:03 PM

The Water Department on Thursday rescinded a boil order that was issued Monday.


 


The boil order covered an area from Village Hall at 105 N. Thorncrest St. to North Hillcrest Terrace. The boil order also had included LaSalle Elementary School at 100 N. Highland Ave.

Boil Water Notice Continues For Cottage Hill Water Works

September 14, 2012

A precautionary boil water notice has been issued for a portion of the Cottage Hill Water Works System, including:

  • McKenize Rd
  • Parker Rd
  • Chavers Rd
  • Smyers Rd
  • Elna Rd Williams Ditch Road 1501-1744
  • Hwy 95A North from1756-1999
  • Cottage Park Rd.
  • Grenelefe Dr. Handy Rd
  • Eastman Ln
  • Buckhead Trace
  • Heathrow Dr
  • Hollow Point
  • Nosler Ct
  • Ballistic Tip
  • Soft Point Dr

This notice is being issued following a water main break. Residents are advised to boil water for one minute at a rolling boil or to use six drops of regular unscented household bleach per gallon of water for water to be used for drinking or cooking purposes.

Bacteriological sampling is underway and the advisory will be lifted as soon as possible.

A crew has repaired the main and is flushing out the lines. Residents are advised that there is a possibility of discolored water as a result of the break and flushing, and to flush their home’s plumbing by running their taps for a few minutes. If you have questions, contact the Cottage Hill Water Works office at (850) 968-5485.

11 Responses to “Boil Water Notice Continues For Cottage Hill Water Works”

  1. kat on September 16th, 2012 10:03 pm

    I wasn’t notified either and we’ve been drinking tap water all this weekend. If I get sick, who is at fault? With all the technology in the world, it is truly a shame that CHWW can’t get a little bit to protect my family’s safety.

    Heck, they can’t even get someone to ACTUALLY read the meter! Whomever is ’supposed’ to be reading ours just estimates and only really reads it about once a quarter…I want that dudes job.

  2. water customer on September 16th, 2012 6:31 pm

    Boil water notice requirements as of state law 62-555.335 Fac.
    Water systems in the state of fl. are required to report any equipment failures,main breaks,or break downs to the appropriate Department of environmental protection ,department of health,and issue a precautionary boil water notice to all customers effected by such occurrence as soon as possible and no later than noon the next day. A bacteriological survey must then be completed by an approved lab or approved county health dept. to insure the quality of drinking water before this notice can be rescinded. It takes a min. of 48hrs. in the lab for this survey to be completed.this survey cannot begin until the problem is corrected,the required number of samples are collected after flushing,and delivered to the lab. The labs are closed on the weekends so add those days if the collection of samples fall on saturday or sunday.
    Boil water notices can be delivered by method of TV,Newspaper,Radio,Door hangers,Phone call or Local postings [grocery store, local post office etc.] The trouble with TV and some other methods is they are requested by your local water system to run these notices and they do not. There is no state law requiring them to run them so they may or may not run these type notices. Most Water systems try more than whats required of them to get everyone notified. They also strive to deliver a quality drinking water to our homes after all Drinking water is their product thats for sell. Consider this, there are miles of water mains, that deliver millions of gals. of water to our homes and supply our fire hydrants and irrigate our yards and gardens for less than 1/2 cent per gal. there are pumps that pump this same water and elevated storage tanks that store this water and the routine maintenance and repairs for all this plus trucks,tools,equipment,employees,thousands of dollars of samples to pull each year,building maintenance etc. and all for less than 1/2 cent per gal.
    Sure beats running down to the creek to catch up a few of these gals. don’t you think?

  3. Arrington on September 16th, 2012 8:06 am

    To Notice… I understand breaks are not scheduled events, but there are plenty of ways to notify residents of a problem that will result in their water being off ALL day.

  4. notice? on September 15th, 2012 8:08 am

    How can you provide advance notice of the need to shut off water due to a main break?

    Breaks are not normally scheduled events.

  5. Arrington on September 14th, 2012 5:16 pm

    My husband came home from work Thursday evening to find our horses, cows, and dog with NO water! We have an automatic watering system for them and when the water is turned off without notice this is what happens. It would be greatly appreciated if cottage hill water would properly inform us when the water will be off, so we can make other plans for our animals!

  6. bill on September 14th, 2012 2:50 pm

    As a precaution’ if your water pressure drops below 20 psi for a 20 minute period, boil your water until you hear differently. If you don’t hear a boil water warning, call the water works. 968-5485 and check on with them.

  7. Tonya on September 14th, 2012 2:25 pm

    i too, am a little upset that there was no way that we were notified. an email, automated phone call, something, should have been done to let all CHWW consumers know about the boil notice. if it hadnt been for someone telling me on facebook that it was on here, i would still be in the dark about it. and further still, i wouldnt know if we were still under a boil notice until monday if amber above had not shared that information. i think a better system needs to be put in place to let us know what is going on when something like that happens.

  8. local resident on September 14th, 2012 2:06 pm

    wow, monday?! that’s quite a long time for such. but better to be safe than sorry. i’m just glad we have water pressure now. it’s hard not to take the little things for granted, and i’m telling you i am greatful even if i do have to boil it before using it. =)

  9. amber bush on September 14th, 2012 11:50 am

    I just called them and they said the boil water notice will be in affect until Monday.

    Just now, almost 8:30 pm, I get a phone call, not from CHWW, but from a relative, that we are under the boil water notification! All day long, and they couldn’t alert the public to a potential contaminated water system???

(6) Limit your comments to the subject in this story only, and limit comments to 300 words or less. Do not post copyrighted material. Comments will not be added to stories that are over 30 days old.

(7) No posts may advertise a commercial business or political group, or link to another commercial web site or political site of any kind.

Boil water advisory in Rensselaer

Updated 9:07 pm, Thursday, September 13, 2012

RENSSELAER — The city of Rensselaer has a boil water advisory in effect until 5 p.m. Friday after a vehicle hit a fire hydrant on Washington Avenue.

The affected area runs from I-90 East to Route 4. It includes Van Allen Park and Eastland Park to the Mansions.

For further information, call the city police department at 462-7451.

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>The gated community of Lake Perry in Perry County was under a boil-water order since Sept. 6, as an accidental cross-connection between two pipes caused the community’s water source to be contaminated. However, as of 8 a.m. this morning, the order was lifted by the Department of Natural Resources once several water tests came back negative for contaminants Wednesday.</p>
<p>Water samples were taken and tested Monday and Tuesday by DNR to ensure that Lake Perry residents can safety drink and bathe with the area’s water supply.</p>
<p>Mike Yamnitz, president of Port Perry Service Company that services the area’s water needs, said a cross-connection occurred, not at the hands of Port Perry Service, but of a private contractor who mistakenly hooked up an incorrect pipe to another.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>“The water was cross-connected with another hook-up,” he said Monday. “The water is contaminated. As of right now, all of Lake Perry is under the water boil order.”</p>
<p>The way in which a problem was discovered was an odor that emanated from a resident’s home.</p>
<p>“We were notified of an order in a residence,” Yamnitz said. “We investigated and found the cross-connection late Thursday evening [Sept. 6]. We immediately started notifying residents and began flushing the system, and DNR was contacted. By Friday morning, a repair to the cross-connection had been made.”</p>
<p>Regardless of the repair, a water boil order was necessary.</p>
<p>“Only five residents were affected by the entire problem, but the whole area has to be boiling water to ensure safety,” he said.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><p>Though there are roughly 60 homes in the Lake Perry area, only 20-30 homes are active and have full-time residents. Those 20-30 residents were asked to drain any stored water supplies they may have had (ice cube trays, jugs of tap water, etc.), and to boil any water they used after the order was in effect.</p>
<p>“This order is in effect until DNR tells us we can take it down,” Yamnitz said.</p>
<p>Monday and Tuesday were reserved for testing of water samples (three samples on each day). It would’ve occurred sooner, but the cross-connection occurred just before a weekend, when DNR has no testing facilities open, Yamnitz said.</p>
<p>“At this point it’s just a matter of going through all the bells and whistles to get the water back to where it needs to be,” he said. “But I’d like to thank everyone for their cooperation and patience at this time.”</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset, btf","fold":"below","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>

<div class="asset-side-sticky" id="sticky-right-rail"><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-global-side-sticky"></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-asset_side_sticky"></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Campo Alternative School

BOIL WATER ORDER AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION FOR CAMPO ALTERNATIVE SCHOOL AND CAMPO LIBRARY WATER SYSTEM

  • campo
  • boil water order
  • Campo Alternative School
  • Campo Library
  • News

September 13, 2012 (Campo)--The County of San Diego, Department of Environmental Health (DEH) has issued a Boil Water Order and Public Notification for the Campo Alternative School and Campo Library drinking water system located on 31360 Highway 94, Campo, CA 91906 effective immediately. 

The drinking water system has tested present for total coliform bacteria and absent for E.coli.

Water advisory lifted in Carolina Beach

Response workers struggle through neck high water to fix the break Monday night.
Crews working on the scene at Tarboro Avenue and Dow Road.

CAROLINA BEACH, NC (WECT) - Residents in Carolina Beach should no longer have to boil their water as a cautionary measure, according to town leaders.

The town had been under advisory Tuesday after a water main break on Dow Road. Recent tests show no coliform bacteria in the water.

Dow Road in Carolina Beach is open again after being blocked to traffic Monday night because of a water main break on Tarboro Avenue.

Traffic was blocked at the 400 block of North Dow Road because of flooding. Some places were high enough for workers to swim.

Crews on the scene said they were working on recirculating water pipes in the area, so everyone would have equal water pressure. When they cut a 12 inch water line, they also hit an unmarked water valve believed to be covered up by NCDOT.

Engineers on the scene said Carolina Beach crews are not at fault for the accident.

Carolina Beach crews opened fire hydrants on a number of streets to relieve the pressure for the water main break on Tarboro Avenue.

Some neighbors in the area said they had been without water since 5 p.m. Monday. They said crews have been in the area since that time.

Nanoparticles Let Water Boil Without Bubbling, Future Is Officially Now

by Ian Chant | 6:15 pm, September 12th, 2012
 

I don’t know how many times you’ve let water boil over the sides of a pot while cooking pasta, but if you’re anything like me the number is somewhere in the ballpark of “a bajillion times.” That travesty may soon be a thing of the past, thanks to nanoparticles which can disperse heat in boiling water, making sure your water comes to an extremely hot boil while remaining as placid as a remote mountain lake. A mountain lake filled with delicious spaghetti. Also, yes, I’ve totally had that dream before. It’s a happy place for me.

By coating 2cm steel spheres in nanoparticles, researchers were able to, in effect, greatly increase the surface area of the tiny metal balls by giving them a rough coating. That lets researchres create what is essentially an artificial vapor layer around the spheres. That artificial vapor layer replaces the one that usually forms at the surface of the pot, where bubbles roil and spray over the top of a pot that you stepped away from for like, seriously, ten seconds, how does this even happen every time? Anyway, the rough coating gave water a place to stretch and move along rather than moving violently to the top of the pot, which remained undisturbed.

This is new research, so there are clearly still some kinks to iron out. For example, there’s no word yet on the pressing matter of whether or not the steel balls will also let cooks boil water while still watching it. There’s also no reason anyone would want to have tiny steel balls in their fresh pasta, which seems like a lawsuit looking for a place to happen. Before you ask, no, we don’t know how you will be able to tell when your water has come to a boil without bubbles to indicate that it is, in fact, very, very hot. Put your hand in it, I guess? Not, like the hand you use a lot, though. That would just be silly.

(via New Scientist)

Relevant to your interests

  • Now we need a self-cleaning colander…er, FSM church headgear
  • That said, we’ll settle for this neato folding colander
  • Just don’t cook ramen in it. Just…don’t

Boil water order for Bal Harbour lifted

Repairs continue on water main break

Posted: 2:55 PM, September 12, 2012 Updated: 2:55 PM, September 12, 2012

BAL HARBOUR, Fla. - A boil water order for Bal Harbour has been lifted.

Bal Harbour Village received a second set of positive tests on Wednesday, said Jay Smith, the Director of Human Resources and Community Outreach.

Repairs continued on a broken water main, but the repairs shouldn't affect the quality of the water.

</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>When The Ladder Community Center opened its doors in February 2016 in Shelby, it was out of a vision, a goal, to foster neighborliness, service and transform lives. <p>WASHINGTON (AP) — A whistleblower has told House Democrats that during President Donald Trump's inauguration speech, national security adviser Michael Flynn texted a former business associate to say a private nuclear reactor plan Flynn had lobbied for would also have his support in the White House. </p>

<div class="card-lead">
<p>RENO, Nev. (AP) — A new analysis of legislative conflicts of interest by The Associated Press and Center for Public Integrity found numerous examples around the country of state lawmakers voting on bills that ended up benefiting their own business interests. </p>

<div class="card-headline">
<h4 class="">

        Realizing the impact of integration</a></h4>
</div>
<div class="card-meta">
<ul class="list-inline">
<li>
<time class="asset-date text-muted" datetime="2017-10-18T15:52:00-04:00">Oct 18, 2017</time></li>
<li></li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>IHAP®’s goal is to assess the progress of the whole person health journey for each participant. The program accomplishes this by establishing realistic goals and looking at the impact on and improvements to the participant. IHAP also seeks to measure and quantify these improvements, and continually look at the sustainability the changes the participant is making. This process documents the in-depth communication among the IHAP® team, the participants and their health care providers ... this testimonial was provided by a current IHAP participant.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>
</article>

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/oceanas_herald_journal/news/world/for-tillerson-a-lonely-job-defending-trump-s-jerusalem-move/article_3a607ccd-9580-5435-87ec-a320009c4adf.html">
        

        
        For Tillerson, a lonely job defending Trump's Jerusalem move</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-meta">
<ul class="list-inline">
<li>
<time class="asset-date text-muted" datetime="2017-12-06T14:01:32-05:00">7 min ago</time></li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>BRUSSELS (AP) — It's a go-to catchphrase when U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson is called on to explain his boss on the world stage: "America first is not America alone." Yet as President Donald Trump declared Jerusalem the capital of Israel, Tillerson on Wednesday stood all by himself. </p>
</div>

</article>

            $(window).load(function() {

                var bizTracked = [];
                var isUserAction = false;

                function trackActive(owl){
                    if( bizTracked.length == 10 ){
                        return;
                    }else{
                        var activeThings = $(owl).find('.owl-item.active');

                        $.each(activeThings, function(index, value){
                            var bizId = $(this).find('.card').data('bizid');
                            var hasBeenLogged = false;

                            bizTracked.forEach(function (item, index, array) {
                                if(item == bizId){
                                    hasBeenLogged = true;
                                    return true;
                                }
                            });
                            if( hasBeenLogged == false ){
                                bizTracked.push(bizId);
                                TNCMS.Tracking.addEvent({
                                    app: 'business',
                                    metric: 'block',
                                    id: bizId
                                });
                            }
                        });
                    }
                }

                window.card_carousel_1267357 = $('#block-1267357 .owl-carousel');

                

                card_carousel_1267357.owlCarousel({
                    loop:true,
                    margin:15,
                    nav:false,
                    dots:false,
                    slideBy: 'page',
                    autoHeight:false,
                    
                        autoplay: true,
                        autoplayHoverPause: true, 
                        autoplayTimeout: 5000,
                    
                    responsiveClass:true,
                    responsive:{
                        0:{
                            items:1,
                            stagePadding: 40,
                            nav:false
                        },
                        600:{
                            items:4
                        },
                        1000:{
                            items:1
                        }
                    }
                });

                // bind previous click
                $('#block-1267357 .owl-carousel-control.prev').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1267357.trigger('prev.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind next click
                $('#block-1267357 .owl-carousel-control.next').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1267357.trigger('next.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind dragged
                card_carousel_1267357.on('dragged.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind translated
                card_carousel_1267357.on('translated.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    if( isUserAction ){
                        trackActive(card_carousel_1267357);
                        isUserAction = false;
                    }
                });
            });
        </script>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>The gated community of Lake Perry in Perry County has been under a water boil order since Sept. 6, as an accidental cross-connection between two pipes caused the community's water source to be contaminated.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>As of Monday, officials say water samples are currently being processed to determine whether the water is safe again for residents. About 30 residents were affected, and have been asked to boil any water, and dispose of any stored water they had around the time of the contamination. </p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><p>Officials say by Wednesday or Thursday, they're hoping to lift the water boil order. </p>
<p>For more on this, read the article in Thursday's Republic-Monitor, issue date Sept. 13.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset, btf","fold":"below","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com\/perryvillenews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

Water advisory lifted in Carolina Beach

Response workers struggle through neck high water to fix the break Monday night.
Crews working on the scene at Tarboro Avenue and Dow Road.

CAROLINA BEACH, NC (WECT) - Residents in Carolina Beach should no longer have to boil their water as a cautionary measure, according to town leaders.

The town had been under advisory Tuesday after a water main break on Dow Road. Recent tests show no coliform bacteria in the water.

Dow Road in Carolina Beach is open again after being blocked to traffic Monday night because of a water main break on Tarboro Avenue.

Traffic was blocked at the 400 block of North Dow Road because of flooding. Some places were high enough for workers to swim.

Crews on the scene said they were working on recirculating water pipes in the area, so everyone would have equal water pressure. When they cut a 12 inch water line, they also hit an unmarked water valve believed to be covered up by NCDOT.

Engineers on the scene said Carolina Beach crews are not at fault for the accident.

Carolina Beach crews opened fire hydrants on a number of streets to relieve the pressure for the water main break on Tarboro Avenue.

Some neighbors in the area said they had been without water since 5 p.m. Monday. They said crews have been in the area since that time.
